ygData.messageBody:
> Well after awhile you have to talk about something I mean how many topics
> can you talk about? Especially 7 months after the game. If something nice
> about the bard happens in game then I guaruntee you that it will be posted
> up immediatly but until it does we need to talk about something.

And I apologize for bringing in the politics into this list.
The world revolves around politics, and thus naturally Norrath
would make an extension of the real world. It was inevitable.

The truth is this list is very reflective of the state of the game.
We are all grown up now. I came here when I was L20, that was a long
time ago. I've learned a lot here, made a lot of friends, pissed
off a lot of people, etc.

Everyone has opinions.

Every server is being aflicted by a power guild(s) taking over the
things that 90% of the rest of the server would like to do. This
in every way affects Bards... and Enchanters, and Warriors, and etc.
In the past this list has proposed solutions to non-bard questions,
thus is the nature of the list to investigate and solve problems.
I can guarentee that this list distributes more in-game mechanics
than any of list out there. But more than that, it distributes
a fun and cheerful attitude. As bards, we know a little bit about
everything, justly so.

The hot topic of elite guilds taking over the server is something
which needs to addressed, as it impacts all of us.

It's not: What <foo> instrument has <foo> effect.

But how much more can we talk about songs and instruments? There
is nothing new to discuss. Until a patch or new song/skill, that
is. I've also found people here have a very solid understanding
of the game as a whole and it's playability. So, maybe a new
list needs to be created to voice out playability issues to other
people of similiar or like minds, but I find you all to be the
first place to turn to for _any_ eq advice.

We all share a common thread, but that common thread is storytelling,
general advice, and not just when selo's outruns sow, or why X song
isn't working right.

Again I apologize for the post, however this problem is plaguing
the community as a whole and wanted to make the bard community,
at least, aware of it's strain on some of us.

Harmonic.
